chat.content:
I will give you a Coq proof state, including both hypotheses and a specific goal and your need to prove it. Your response should be a singular code block of Coq proof starting with "```coq
", ending with "Qed.```", without any additional explanation or commentary. Follow to these guidelines:
Introduce variables using unique names to avoid any conflicts.
Keep each command distinct and separated, avoid concatenations like ';' or '[cmd|cmd]'.
Organize your proof with bullets like '-', '+', and '*' instead of braces ({, }). Shift to their double symbols like '--' and '++', when necessary.
Effectively use given premises, follow the syntax and structure demonstrated in the examples provided.

Example 1:

Hypotheses:
n, m: nat
IHn: m + n = n + m

Goal:
m + S n = S n + m

Proof:
```coq
simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.
Qed.```

Example 2:
Hypotheses:

Goal:
forall n m : nat, m + n = n + m

```coq
intros n m. induction n.
- simpl. auto.
- simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.
Qed.```

Solve This Proof State:

Hypotheses:
X: Type
x: X
b: nat
a: nat

Goal:
list_repeat x (a + b) = list_repeat x a ++ list_repeat x b

Premises:
list_repeat : forall X : Type, X -> nat -> list X
list_an_duplicate_inv : forall (a n : nat) (l : list nat) (x : nat) (m : list nat) (y : nat) (r : list nat), list_an a n = l ++ x :: m ++ y :: r -> a <= x /\ x < y < a + n
app_eq_unit : forall (A : Type) (x y : list A) (a : A), x ++ y = a :: nil -> x = nil /\ y = a :: nil \/ x = a :: nil /\ y = nil
app_inj_tail : forall (A : Type) (x y : list A) (a b : A), x ++ a :: nil = y ++ b :: nil -> x = y /\ a = b
remove_app : forall (A : Type) (eq_dec : forall x y : A, {x = y} + {x <> y}) (x : A) (l1 l2 : list A), remove eq_dec x (l1 ++ l2) = remove eq_dec x l1 ++ remove eq_dec x l2
app_comm_cons : forall (A : Type) (x y : list A) (a : A), a :: x ++ y = (a :: x) ++ y
app_cons_not_nil : forall (A : Type) (x y : list A) (a : A), nil <> x ++ a :: y
Inductive sig (A : Type) (P : A -> Prop) : Type := exist : forall x : A, P x -> {x : A | P x} Arguments sig [A]%type_scope _%type_scope Arguments exist [A]%type_scope _%function_scope
Inductive sigT (A : Type) (P : A -> Type) : Type := existT : forall x : A, P x -> {x : A & P x} Arguments sigT [A]%type_scope _%type_scope Arguments existT [A]%type_scope _%function_scope
Add_cons : forall (A : Type) (a x : A) (l l' : list A), Add a l l' -> Add a (x :: l) (x :: l')
in_elt_inv : forall (A : Type) (x y : A) (l1 l2 : list A), In x (l1 ++ y :: l2) -> x = y \/ In x (l1 ++ l2)
remove : forall A : Type, (forall x y : A, {x = y} + {x <> y}) -> A -> list A -> list A
Permutation_elt_map_inv : forall (A B : Type) (f : A -> B) (l1 l2 l3 : list B) (l4 : list A) (a : B), l1 ++ a :: l2 ~p l3 ++ map f l4 -> (forall b : A, a <> f b) -> exists l1' l2' : list B, l3 = l1' ++ a :: l2'
Relation_Operators.Lt_hd : forall (A : Set) (leA : A -> A -> Prop) (a b : A), leA a b -> forall x y : list A, Relation_Operators.Ltl A leA (a :: x) (b :: y)
list_an_app_inv : forall (a n : nat) (l r : list nat), list_an a n = l ++ r -> l = list_an a (length l) /\ r = list_an (a + length l) (length r)
BinInt.Z.lt = fun x y : BinNums.Z => BinInt.Z.compare x y = Lt : BinNums.Z -> BinNums.Z -> Prop Arguments BinInt.Z.lt (_ _)%Z_scope
list_an_plus : forall a n m : nat, list_an a (n + m) = list_an a n ++ list_an (n + a) m
in_elt : forall (A : Type) (x : A) (l1 l2 : list A), In x (l1 ++ x :: l2)
f_equal_nat : forall (B : Type) (f : nat -> B) (x y : nat), x = y -> f x = f y
in_map_iff : forall (A B : Type) (f : A -> B) (l : list A) (y : B), In y (map f l) < -> (exists x : A, f x = y /\ In x l)
Lexicographic_Exponentiation.dist_aux : forall (A : Set) (leA : A -> A -> Prop) (z : list A), Relation_Operators.Desc A leA z -> forall x y : list A, z = x ++ y -> Relation_Operators.Desc A leA x /\ Relation_Operators.Desc A leA y
Permutation_cons_append : forall (A : Type) (l : list A) (x : A), x :: l ~p l ++ x :: nil
BinInt.Z.le = fun x y : BinNums.Z => BinInt.Z.compare x y <> Gt : BinNums.Z -> BinNums.Z -> Prop Arguments BinInt.Z.le (_ _)%Z_scope
Inductive clos_refl (A : Type) (R : Relation_Definitions.relation A) (x : A) : A -> Prop := r_step : forall y : A, R x y -> Relation_Operators.clos_refl A R x y | r_refl : Relation_Operators.clos_refl A R x x Arguments Relation_Operators.clos_refl _%type_scope Arguments Relation_Operators.r_step _%type_scope Arguments Relation_Operators.r_refl _%type_scope
Lexicographic_Exponentiation.right_prefix : forall (A : Set) (leA : A -> A -> Prop) (x y z : list A), Relation_Operators.Ltl A leA x (y ++ z) -> Relation_Operators.Ltl A leA x y \/ (exists y' : list A, x = y ++ y' /\ Relation_Operators.Ltl A leA y' z)
in_split : forall (A : Type) (x : A) (l : list A), In x l -> exists l1 l2 : list A, l = l1 ++ x :: l2
perm_t_swap : forall (A : Type) (x y : A) (l1 l2 : list A), Permutation_transp (l1 ++ y :: x :: l2) (l1 ++ x :: y :: l2)
Permutation_in : forall (A : Type) (l l' : list A) (x : A), l ~p l' -> In x l -> In x l'
perm_skip : forall (A : Type) (x : A) (l l' : list A), l ~p l' -> x :: l ~p x :: l'
perm_swap : forall (A : Type) (x y : A) (l : list A), y :: x :: l ~p x :: y :: l
Inductive Ltl (A : Set) (leA : A -> A -> Prop) : list A -> list A -> Prop := Lt_nil : forall (a : A) (x : list A), Relation_Operators.Ltl A leA nil (a :: x) | Lt_hd : forall a b : A, leA a b ->...-> Relation_Operators.Ltl A leA (a :: x) (a :: y) Arguments Relation_Operators.Ltl _%type_scope _%function_scope (_ _)%list_scope Arguments Relation_Operators.Lt_nil _%type_scope _%function_scope _ _%list_scope Arguments Relation_Operators.Lt_hd _%type_scope _%function_scope _ _ _ (_ _)%list_scope Arguments Relation_Operators.Lt_tl _%type_scope _%function_scope _ (_ _)%list_scope
